title: Vatican Deems Bigger Role for Women ‘Urgent’ but Punts on Major Issues
description: Progressives who once hoped that the synod would create momentum for things like reaching out to L.G.B.T.Q.+ Catholics said the meeting had failed to move the institution.

title: Fisherman Not Seen in Two Weeks Is Rescued at Sea
description: A fishing vessel with two aboard left Washington State on Oct. 12 and was reported missing on Sunday. On Thursday, one of the men was rescued, officials said.

title: Joanna Merlin, Known for Her Work Both Onstage and Off, Dies at 92
description: Soon after appearing in the original Broadway production of “Fiddler on the Roof,” she began a new career as a prominent casting director.

title: At Republican Jewish Coalition Event, Haley Criticizes Trump for Comments on Israel-Hamas War
description: The former United Nations ambassador delivered remarks with other candidates at the annual Republican Jewish Coalition gathering, criticizing her former boss and his comments about the Israel-Hamas conflict.

title: ‘Lewiston Strong’: After Mass Shooting, Residents Emerge With Grit
description: After two long days of being locked down amid the manhunt for a gunman who killed 18 people, the small city in Maine started to come back to life, forever changed.

title: Migrants in NYC Search for Beds as City Stops Offering Shelter to Some
description: “They want you to get tired so you give up, and they are achieving it,” said one migrant who has been searching for a place to stay in New York City for several days.

title: U.A.W. Reaches Tentative Deal With Stellantis, Following Ford
description: Stellantis, the parent of Chrysler, Jeep and Ram, and the United Automobile Workers union said they had reached a deal on a new contract similar to the one that the union reached with Ford.

title: Mike Pence Drops Out of 2024 Presidential Race
description: He increasingly attacked Donald Trump over Jan. 6, but gained little traction and struggled to raise money.

title: ‘You Think of Dying at Any Time’
description: Gaza residents say Israeli airstrikes come mostly without warning and hit indiscriminately, leading to the feeling that death is imminent and inevitable.

title: Gunman in Maine Mass Shooting Had Paranoid Beliefs, Officials Say
description: The man was found dead on Friday night, ending a two-day manhunt. The police said he had legally purchased several guns, including in recent days.

title: Joanna Merlin, Known for Her Work Both Onstage and Off, Dies at 92
description: Soon after appearing in the original Broadway production of “Fiddler on the Roof,” she began a new career as a prominent casting director.

title: Gunman in Maine Mass Shooting Had Paranoid Beliefs, Officials Say
description: The man was found dead on Friday night, ending a two-day manhunt. The police said he had legally purchased several guns, including in recent days.

title: Russia’s Former Pick to Be Ukraine’s Puppet Leader Is Shot in Crimea
description: Oleg Tsaryov, a pro-Russian businessman and former lawmaker, was said to have been wounded in the attack. Moscow had planned to set him up as head of government in Kyiv if its invasion had succeeded.

title: Where Hamas Is Winning
description: When barbarity has a revolutionary logic.

title: Biden’s Defense of Israel Is Rooted in a Long Career
description: The president’s “unwavering support” for Israel stems from childhood dinner table conversations and half a century of trips to the Jewish state. But it puts him at odds with some in his own party.

title: In Michigan, Muslim and Arab American Voters Reconsider Support for Biden
description: Many in the swing state say they feel betrayed by the president’s support for Israel.

title: In Gaza, a Question of Strategy and Morality
description: Israel has every right to defend itself and fight terrorists. But is this really the best way?

title: I Fought for the I.D.F. in Gaza. It Made Me Fight for Peace.
description: An Israeli veteran reflects on his experience the last time Israeli troops entered Gaza in force.

title: A Dispatch From the Muslim Girl Scouts of Astoria
description: A young activist in Queens supports Palestinian aspirations.

title: Listen Early to ‘This American Life’: And the Call Was Coming From the Basement
description: Zombie raccoons, David Sedaris and haunted houses.

title: Ghostly Presence
description: In a time when everything’s gone virtual, Halloween costumes represent an old-fashioned commitment to the physical world.

title: The House G.O.P Has Its Leader. But Can He Be a Rainmaker?
description: The former speaker, Kevin McCarthy, was a prolific fund-raiser for his House colleagues. The new speaker, Mike Johnson, doesn’t yet have the same juice.

title: Top 10 Hardest and Easiest Spelling Bee Words, Oct. 21-27
description: This week’s toughest challenge may have been a little bombastic.

title: The ‘Silver Lining to the Pandemic’ for Working Mothers
description: The share of women working has reached a record high, with the biggest increases among mothers of children under 5.

title: Meg Ryan on Her New Rom-Com, ‘What Happens Later’
description: She always had concerns about the happily-ever-after ideals of the genre. Now as a director she’s pushing its boundaries to examine issues of aging and regret.

title: With Fans Ever More Fickle, Sports Leagues Warm to Rule Changes
description: Baseball’s pitch clock is just one example of how professional sports are competing for public attention in an ever-evolving entertainment world.

title: ‘A Bright Light in a Dark Time’: A New School for Uvalde
description: More than a year after a mass shooting at Robb Elementary School, the community is breaking ground on a new campus.

title: A.I. Muddies Israel-Hamas War in Unexpected Way
description: Fakes related to the conflict have been limited and largely unconvincing, but their presence has people doubting real evidence.

title: How Cohen Testimony Sets Stage for Trump’s Criminal Hush Money Trial
description: Michael D. Cohen, Donald J. Trump’s former fixer, was not an essential witness in Mr. Trump’s civil fraud trial this week. He will be when he takes the stand in a Manhattan criminal case.

title: Early Voting Begins in New York: Here’s What to Know
description: Although no citywide offices are being contested this year, the New York City Council is up for election, and voters statewide will consider two ballot questions.

title: Richard Moll, Towering Bailiff on ‘Night Court,’ Dies at 80
description: In a career that spanned more than four decades, the actor was best known for playing the imposing but lovable Bull Shannon on the NBC sitcom.

title: Suspect in Maine Shooting Is Found Dead, Ending Sprawling Manhunt
description: The body of the man suspected of killing 18 and injuring 13 others in Lewiston was found with an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound late Friday.

title: For Mike Johnson, Religion Is at the Forefront of Politics and Policy
description: The new House speaker has put his faith at the center of his political career, and aligned himself with a newer cohort of conservative Christianity that some describe as Christian nationalism.

title: Team Trump Revives Attack Ads Against DeSantis in Iowa
description: A super PAC supporting Trump is shifting its strategy again, with less than three months before the state’s first-in-the-nation caucuses.

title: Hawaii Settles Sex Discrimination Case With High School Female Athletes
description: The landmark class-action case was one of the farthest-reaching challenges to high school sports under federal Title IX protections.

title: On Race, House Speaker Mike Johnson Says His Views Were Shaped By Raising a Black Child
description: The new House speaker has kept his oldest son out of the public eye — except when the Republican talks about race.

title: After Shooting, Maine Senators in the Spotlight on Guns
description: The shooting in Lewiston that left 18 dead prompted the town’s conservative Democratic representative to embrace an assault weapons ban, but Senators Susan Collins and Angus King are still resisting.
